title: How to Make an Apple Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).
Spray a 9 x 13 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.
Fold in the sugar, flour, oil, eggs, salt, baking soda, vanilla extract, and cinnamon in a large bowl.
steps.description: Mix well with a whisk.

steps.headline: Whisk the milk in, run flour, cinnamon and baking powder into batter and stir it together.
Add the chopped apples into the batter.
Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the oven for about an hour, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Frost and decorate the cake.
steps.description: Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).
Spray a 9 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.
Stir the dry ingredients with a whisk.
steps.description: Mix the baking powder, flour, and salt.

steps.headline: In a separate large bowl, cream the butter sugar using a hand or electric blender.
steps.description: Cream the mixture for about 3 minutes, until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, vanilla, and rum.
steps.description: Crack in the eggs, one at a time. Pour in the vanilla extract and rum. Mix on medium speed until well-combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Blend on low speed until the batter starts to look creamy and slightly grainy.

steps.headline: Fold in the apples.
steps.description: Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the oven for about 40 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Frost and decorate the cake.
steps.description: Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).
Spray a 9 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.
In a large bowl, whisk the melted butter and milk until well-combined.
In a separate bowl sift the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Sift the flour, baking powder, and baking soda until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Pour the butter mixture into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Stir well with a whisk. The batter will be slightly dry.

steps.headline: Add the milk, oil, and vinegar.
steps.description: Mix again until the cake batter starts to form and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Pour in the vanilla and apples.
steps.description: Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the oven for about 50-55 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Frost and decorate the cake.
steps.description: Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spray a 9 x 13 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.
In a medium-sized bowl beat the eggs and oil using an electric mixer.
steps.description: Beat until the mixture is creamy.

steps.headline: Pour in the sugar and vanilla.
steps.description: Mix again.

steps.headline: In a separate large bowl mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Whisk the cinnamon, baking soda, flour, and salt. Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Mix on low speed for about two minutes, until the cake batter is creamy and there no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Fold in the apples and mix.
Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the oven for about 45 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Frost and decorate the cake.
steps.description: Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).
Spray a 9 x 13 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.
Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: In a separate medium-sized bowl, whisk the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Beat the eggs, coconut oil, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Whisk until properly combined.

steps.headline: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry.
steps.description: Mix using an electric mixer for about two minutes, until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Fold in the apples and mix.
Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the oven for about 40-45 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Frost and decorate the cake.
steps.description: Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).
Spray a 9 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.
In a large bowl whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Mix the sugar, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt until well-combined.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl beat the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Whisk the oil, vanilla, water, and vinegar until well-combined.

steps.headline: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry.
steps.description: Mix using an electric mixer for about two minutes, until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Fold in the apples and mix.
Pour the cake batter into the cake pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the oven for about 40-45 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.
Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Frost and decorate the cake.
steps.description: Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate.

text: Basic Apple Cake Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).  Spray a 9 x 13 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.  Fold in the sugar, flour, oil, eggs, salt, baking soda, vanilla extract, and cinnamon in a large bowl. Mix well with a whisk. Whisk the milk in, run flour, cinnamon and baking powder into batter and stir it together.  Add the chopped apples into the batter.  Pour the cake batter into the cake pan. Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula. Bake the cake in the oven for about an hour, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.  Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Frost and decorate the cake. Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top. Serve. Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy! Moist & Fluffy Apple Cake Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).  Spray a 9 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.  Stir the dry ingredients with a whisk. Mix the baking powder, flour, and salt. In a separate large bowl, cream the butter sugar using a hand or electric blender. Cream the mixture for about 3 minutes, until the mixture is light and fluffy. Add the eggs, vanilla, and rum. Crack in the eggs, one at a time. Pour in the vanilla extract and rum. Mix on medium speed until well-combined. Fold in the dry ingredients. Blend on low speed until the batter starts to look creamy and slightly grainy. Fold in the apples. Mix until well-combined. Pour the cake batter into the cake pan. Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula. Bake the cake in the oven for about 40 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.  Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Frost and decorate the cake. Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top. Serve. Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy! Eggless Apple Cake Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).  Spray a 9 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.  In a large bowl, whisk the melted butter and milk until well-combined.  In a separate bowl sift the dry ingredients. Sift the flour, baking powder, and baking soda until the mixture is light and fluffy. Pour the butter mixture into the dry ingredients. Stir well with a whisk. The batter will be slightly dry. Add the milk, oil, and vinegar. Mix again until the cake batter starts to form and there are no more flour streaks. Pour in the vanilla and apples. Mix until well-combined. Pour the cake batter into the cake pan. Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula. Bake the cake in the oven for about 50-55 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.  Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Frost and decorate the cake. Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top. Serve. Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy! Milkless Apple Cake Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).  Spray a 9 x 13 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.  In a medium-sized bowl beat the eggs and oil using an electric mixer. Beat until the mixture is creamy. Pour in the sugar and vanilla. Mix again. In a separate large bowl mix the dry ingredients. Whisk the cinnamon, baking soda, flour, and salt. Mix until well-combined. Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients. Mix on low speed for about two minutes, until the cake batter is creamy and there no more flour streaks. Fold in the apples and mix.  Pour the cake batter into the cake pan. Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula. Bake the cake in the oven for about 45 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.  Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Frost and decorate the cake. Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top. Serve. Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy! Gluten-Free Apple Cake Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).  Spray a 9 x 13 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.  Mix the dry ingredients. In a large bowl whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Mix until well-combined. In a separate medium-sized bowl, whisk the wet ingredients. Beat the eggs, coconut oil, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Whisk until properly combined. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry. Mix using an electric mixer for about two minutes, until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks. Fold in the apples and mix.  Pour the cake batter into the cake pan. Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula. Bake the cake in the oven for about 40-45 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.  Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Frost and decorate the cake. Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top. Serve. Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy! Vegan Apple Cake Preheat the oven to 350º Fahrenheit (175º Celsius).  Spray a 9 inch cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.  In a large bowl whisk the dry ingredients. Mix the sugar, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt until well-combined. In a separate bowl beat the wet ingredients. Whisk the oil, vanilla, water, and vinegar until well-combined. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry. Mix using an electric mixer for about two minutes, until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks. Fold in the apples and mix.  Pour the cake batter into the cake pan. Scrape any excess cake batter using a rubber spatula. Bake the cake in the oven for about 40-45 minutes, until it rises and the edges are golden brown.  Allow the cake cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Frost and decorate the cake. Consider adding vanilla frosting, cream cheese frosting, or icing. Add extra chopped apples or sprinkle cinnamon on the top. Serve. Slice a piece of cake and lay it on a serving plate.
